reviews.text: Ignore bad comments, we loved this hotel and will be going back. We travelled with a 1 year old and 2 year old, food fantastic, pools lovely, rooms although quite dark were great, entertainment wonderful for kids and adults, thomson flights and reps are crap but thats nothing new!!
reviews.title: Stunning Hotel

reviews.text: Wow this is an excellent hotel, we came in 2010 when it opened it was excellent then and it's still the same now. Entertainment excellent, activities are very good, food is very very good. In the future there is going to be a man made sandy beach which will make it even better.
reviews.title: Sensatori you can't say a lot
Wow
reviews.text: Arrived at sensatori on the 31/5/13

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is wow absolutely beautiful
reviews.title: amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is the best we have been too
reviews.title: Fantastic Service- Recommend for COUPLES ONLY- not families!
Unbelievably Perfect
reviews.text: I stayed here with my family and we were all amazed at how fantastic the hotel was. This was easily the best hotel I've stayed at, a choice of a number of different restaurants including a massive buffet style one which was our favourite. We rented the four poster sunbeds everyday which was perfect for a bit of privacy as there are curtains round the side and staff would bring us free fruit and water everyday. The pool is stunning as the hotel is as a whole. As well as the different restaurants there are also a couple of shops in the hotel that sell jewellery etc. I shared a room with my sister which we both loved and there was even a phone in the toilet! Strange but oddly convenient! Would love to stay here again!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a wonderful week at Sensatori in Tenerife! A week was far too short and we'd go back in a heart beat! Our room was amazing. We had booked a sea view room which was absolutely worth the extra. We had room 4101 which we would highly recommend. The balcony was huge and really caught the afternoon sun which was lovely! The room was gorgeous and the bed was huge and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Fabulous holiday at Sensatori!

reviews.text: The food in all of the restaurants was really good. The breakfasts in Pangea were lovely and there was so much choice! If you can't find what you're looking for here then you're far too fussy! Lunches and dinners were great and there was plenty of choice. We didn't have a problem booking any of the restaurants for dinner and we didn't have the need to book any of the restaurants which weren't included as part of the full board plus.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools were just great and we always were able to find really good loungers by the pool. We alternated between the main pool and the adult pool for a change and they were both very relaxing!
reviews.title: A wonderful second visit!
Pam
reviews.text: We didn't get the room cleaned for a couple of days and so we got the €20 per day green credit which we thought was a great touch. We then used the credit for a bali bed experience. We went for the one with champagne and it really was a fab day! We got English newspapers, sun creams, bottled water, a cheese and ham platter, fruit platter, cake platter and veuve clicquot champagne included in the package. The Bali bed wasin a fab location and you get 2 sun loungers beside the Bali bed for your use throughout the day as well. It cost €150 which sounds pricey, but add in a couple of days green credit and its a really nice treat for your holiday!

Third visit and we really enjoyed it. A few more places have opened in town but with full inclusive it is best for people who mainly stay in. The main buffet pangea was better this time with warmer food, better service, and the other restaurants are still good but service dipped a little in the popular italian. The exchange cleaning for 20 euro credit worked well, cleaned every other day and i had a cocktail a day(i dont do wine). No idea why anyone would all inclusive at the rate they charge given free wine breakfast lunch and dinner but this suited us fine. Kids entertainment/stay and play were well enjoyed.
reviews.title: Need to sort out foldout bed, tlc on pirate pool but other than that great
Beautiful
reviews.text: 2 gripes are fold out bed was horribly uncomfortable . I have a good sofa bed, used really good futons its not hard. The second one is daughter cut herself in pirate pool twice, tiles are coming loose , i think it was a stone that cut her.

We visited for our Silver Wedding Anniversary. We had a lovely time. Thomsons rooms seem to be on the dark side of the hotel but it was not a huge problem for us and their reps were useless apart from that it is a stunning hotel. Would go back in a second but would book with the hotel direct next time.
reviews.title: Flawless Again!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Flawless once again!!!!
reviews.title: Hotel is WOW...but service and food not consistent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned to the Gran Melia having a fantastic time last year (on the Sensatori package, Full Board through Thomson), I traveled with my wife and our 2 year old son. The hotel was beautiful again as usual, the staff were as warm and welcoming too and everything was as we remembered from last year.
reviews.title: Everything we expected and more

reviews.text: Just returned from a week in the Sensatori Tenerife and was slightly nervous after reading some bad reviews. We went with an open mind and didn't read anything on trip advisor for a couple of months before we left as we didn't want to be put off. I had looked at the hotel for quite a while and really wanted to go. We travelled with our 18 month old toddler.
reviews.title: Not a 5 Star Plus in my opinion....

reviews.text: CHECK-IN
reviews.title: Fantastic & would be 5* but...

reviews.text: We didn't arrive at the hotel until about 1am and we were given forms to complete by the Sensatori Rep at the airport - although this wasn't a massive issue I felt that this information could have been pre-populated before our arrival so that all we had to do was sign and then check into our room. It was just personal info, passport details etc - all info Thomson already had. After a long flight and 45 minute transfer, we were not even offered so much as a welcome glass of water at the hotel. We were, however, given a room-service menu which had been laid on especially for guests arriving late and the prices were discounted (i.e 10 euros for a cheese and ham toastie). Check-in at the desk was fast and we were escorted to our room where our cases were already waiting.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel & Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.text: We stayed in a Standard Deluxe Room and our initial impression was excellent. There was a Super Kingsize Bed which was very comfortable and the bathroom was very luxurious with a great power shower. The décor was exactly as described and photographed in the Thomson brochure. I suppose on reflection we could have done with a separate sleeping space for our toddler and I think you can book a suite which has this. The big let down for us was the very small balcony which overlooked a banana plantation and a building site. There were also a few cob webs hanging from the balcony as well. Our room was also at the opposite side of the hotel from the kids splash pool and it was quite a walk to get to especially if you had left something in the room. It is a big resort though so we didn't mind this too much. We had thought about paying the extra for a Garden room before we arrived and I am so glad we didn't - the Garden rooms below us were all totally overlooked with no privacy at all. We noticed that some of the rooms have Sensatori symbols on the door and the rest don't - maybe a coincidence but every room which had the same awful outlook as us was a Sensatori room. The green choice card is a great idea - we used this a couple of times as you don't need the room cleaned every day.
reviews.title: Spectacular hotel, average food, turtles amazing!
